SEARCH
Package dao

Class AbstractDAO<T>

java.lang.Object
dao.AbstractDAO<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of the entity
Direct Known Subclasses:
ClientDAO, LogDAO, OrderDAO, ProductDAO
public abstract class AbstractDAO<T> extends Object
Abstract class that implements the basic CRUD operations (create, read, update, delete) for a database table. Methods are generic and use reflection to access the fields of the entity. Methods "create" and "updateById" use the final object as a parameter. This class should be extended by all DAO classes.
Method create: inserts an entity into the database using "INSERT INTO tableName (fields) VALUES (values)" query.
Method findById: finds an entity in the database using "SELECT * FROM tableName WHERE id = ?" query.
Method findAll: finds all entities in the database using " SELECT * FROM tableName" query.
Method updateById: updates an entity in the database using "UPDATE tableName SET field1 = ?, field2 = ?, ... WHERE id = ?" query.
Method deleteById: deletes an entity from the database using "DELETE FROM tableName WHERE id = ?" query.
Method getTableName: returns the name of the table in the database.
Method mapToEntity: maps the result set of a query to a list of entities.
Method camelCaseToSnakeCase: converts a string from camel case to snake case.

  • Method Details

    • create

      public void create(T entity) throws SQLException, IllegalAccessException
      Inserts an entity into the database using "INSERT INTO tableName (fields) VALUES (values)" query. The fields are extracted from the entity using reflection and the values are set as "?" in the query. The values are set using reflection.
      Parameters:
      entity - The entity to be inserted into the database. The values are extracted using reflection.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the query fails
      IllegalAccessException - If cannot access the fields of the entity

    • findById

      public T findById(int id) throws SQLException
      Maps a ResultSet to an entity
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the entity to be found
      Returns:
      The entity with the given id
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the query fails

    • findAll

      public List<T> findAll() throws SQLException
      Finds all the entities in the database using a "SELECT * FROM table_name" query
      Returns:
      A list of all the entities in the database
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the query fails

    • updateById

      public void updateById(T entity) throws SQLException, IllegalAccessException
      Updates an entity in the database using a "UPDATE table_name SET field1 = value1, field2 = value2, ... WHERE id = ?" query. The fields are extracted from the entity using reflection and the values are set as "?" in the query. The values are set using reflection.
      Parameters:
      entity - The entity to be updated in the database. The values are extracted using reflection.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the query fails
      IllegalAccessException - If cannot access the fields of the entity

    • deleteById

      public void deleteById(int id)
      Deletes an entity from the database using a "DELETE FROM table_name WHERE id = ?" query
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the entity to be deleted
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the query fails

    • mapToEntity

      protected List<T> mapToEntity(ResultSet rs) throws SQLException
      Maps a ResultSet to a list of entities. The entities are created using reflection, the fields are extracted by cycling through the fields of the entity class and the values are set using reflection.
      Parameters:
      rs - The ResultSet to be mapped
      Returns:
      A list of entities
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the query fails

    • getTableName

      protected String getTableName()
      This is a helper method when using Postgresql that returns the name of the table in the database. The name of the table is the plural of the entity name, represented by the entity class in the model package, in lowercase. For example, if the entity is "User", the table name is "users".
      Returns:
      The name of the table in the database

    • camelCaseToSnakeCase

      protected String camelCaseToSnakeCase(String camelCase)
      This is a helper method when using Postgresql database. Postgresql uses snake_case for the column names, but the java convention is camelCase. This method converts a camelCase string to a snake_case string.
      Parameters:
      camelCase - The camelCase string to be converted
      Returns:
      The snake_case string
